item.title: Trees
item.description: Concepts A tree is a data structure which stores elements hierarchically; A tree is made out of a set of nodes connected by edges. Every tree has a single root node, which is a node without a parent node. A parent node points to other nodes; Nodes pointed to are called children nodes. Nodes with no children are called leaf nodes; Nodes with children are interior nodes. Any node can be considered the root of a subtree.
